001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonAutoDetect;
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
011import java.util.Objects;
012
013/** A rotation in a 2d coordinate frame represented a point on the unit circle (cosine and sine). */
014@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
015@JsonAutoDetect(getterVisibility = JsonAutoDetect.Visibility.NONE)
016public class Rotation2d {
017  private final double m_value;
018  private final double m_cos;
019  private final double m_sin;
020
021  /** Constructs a Rotation2d with a default angle of 0 degrees. */
022  public Rotation2d() {
023    m_value = 0.0;
024    m_cos = 1.0;
025    m_sin = 0.0;
026  }
027
028  /**
029   * Constructs a Rotation2d with the given radian value. The x and y don't have to be normalized.
030   *
031   * @param value The value of the angle in radians.
032   */
033  @JsonCreator
034  public Rotation2d(@JsonProperty(required = true, value = "radians") double value) {
035    m_value = value;
036    m_cos = Math.cos(value);
037    m_sin = Math.sin(value);
038  }
039
040  /**
041   * Constructs a Rotation2d with the given x and y (cosine and sine) components.
042   *
043   * @param x The x component or cosine of the rotation.
044   * @param y The y component or sine of the rotation.
045   */
046  public Rotation2d(double x, double y) {
047    double magnitude = Math.hypot(x, y);
048    if (magnitude > 1e-6) {
049      m_sin = y / magnitude;
050      m_cos = x / magnitude;
051    } else {
052      m_sin = 0.0;
053      m_cos = 1.0;
054    }
055    m_value = Math.atan2(m_sin, m_cos);
056  }
057
058  /**
059   * Constructs and returns a Rotation2d with the given degree value.
060   *
061   * @param degrees The value of the angle in degrees.
062   * @return The rotation object with the desired angle value.
063   */
064  public static Rotation2d fromDegrees(double degrees) {
065    return new Rotation2d(Math.toRadians(degrees));
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * Adds two rotations together, with the result being bounded between -pi and pi.
070   *
071   * <p>For example, Rotation2d.fromDegrees(30) + Rotation2d.fromDegrees(60) = Rotation2d{-pi/2}
072   *
073   * @param other The rotation to add.
074   * @return The sum of the two rotations.
075   */
076  public Rotation2d plus(Rotation2d other) {
077    return rotateBy(other);
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Subtracts the new rotation from the current rotation and returns the new rotation.
082   *
083   * <p>For example, Rotation2d.fromDegrees(10) - Rotation2d.fromDegrees(100) = Rotation2d{-pi/2}
084   *
085   * @param other The rotation to subtract.
086   * @return The difference between the two rotations.
087   */
088  public Rotation2d minus(Rotation2d other) {
089    return rotateBy(other.unaryMinus());
090  }
091
092  /**
093   * Takes the inverse of the current rotation. This is simply the negative of the current angular
094   * value.
095   *
096   * @return The inverse of the current rotation.
097   */
098  public Rotation2d unaryMinus() {
099    return new Rotation2d(-m_value);
100  }
101
102  /**
103   * Multiplies the current rotation by a scalar.
104   *
105   * @param scalar The scalar.
106   * @return The new scaled Rotation2d.
107   */
108  public Rotation2d times(double scalar) {
109    return new Rotation2d(m_value * scalar);
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Adds the new rotation to the current rotation using a rotation matrix.
114   *
115   * <p>The matrix multiplication is as follows:
116   *
117   * <pre>
118   * [cos_new]   [other.cos, -other.sin][cos]
119   * [sin_new] = [other.sin,  other.cos][sin]
120   * value_new = atan2(sin_new, cos_new)
121   * </pre>
122   *
123   * @param other The rotation to rotate by.
124   * @return The new rotated Rotation2d.
125   */
126  public Rotation2d rotateBy(Rotation2d other) {
127    return new Rotation2d(
128        m_cos * other.m_cos - m_sin * other.m_sin, m_cos * other.m_sin + m_sin * other.m_cos);
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Returns the radian value of the rotation.
133   *
134   * @return The radian value of the rotation.
135   */
136  @JsonProperty
137  public double getRadians() {
138    return m_value;
139  }
140
141  /**
142   * Returns the degree value of the rotation.
143   *
144   * @return The degree value of the rotation.
145   */
146  public double getDegrees() {
147    return Math.toDegrees(m_value);
148  }
149
150  /**
151   * Returns the cosine of the rotation.
152   *
153   * @return The cosine of the rotation.
154   */
155  public double getCos() {
156    return m_cos;
157  }
158
159  /**
160   * Returns the sine of the rotation.
161   *
162   * @return The sine of the rotation.
163   */
164  public double getSin() {
165    return m_sin;
166  }
167
168  /**
169   * Returns the tangent of the rotation.
170   *
171   * @return The tangent of the rotation.
172   */
173  public double getTan() {
174    return m_sin / m_cos;
175  }
176
177  @Override
178  public String toString() {
179    return String.format("Rotation2d(Rads: %.2f, Deg: %.2f)", m_value, Math.toDegrees(m_value));
180  }
181
182  /**
183   * Checks equality between this Rotation2d and another object.
184   *
185   * @param obj The other object.
186   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
187   */
188  @Override
189  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
190    if (obj instanceof Rotation2d) {
191      var other = (Rotation2d) obj;
192      return Math.hypot(m_cos - other.m_cos, m_sin - other.m_sin) < 1E-9;
193    }
194    return false;
195  }
196
197  @Override
198  public int hashCode() {
199    return Objects.hash(m_value);
200  }
201}
